text: Patricia Agnes Glassop (6 July 1926 – 21 September 2010), also professionally known as Patricia Hutchence was an Australian film and television makeup artist, and was the mother of INXS frontman Michael Hutchence. In later years she was an author. ==Biography== Patricia Agnes Kennedy was born on 6 July 1926. In her teens she became a model and carried on modeling up to her thirties. Official Website Patricia Agnes Glassop nee Kennedy 6 July 1929 – 21 September 2010 She was married at age of eighteen. A year later, she had a daughter named Tina. She later divorced her first husband. When she was thirty years old, she married her second husband Kelland Hutchence.Inside Film Tue 25/02/2014 Tina Hutchence speaks out On 22 January 1960 her first son Michael was born.Kylie - Naked: A Biography By Jenny Stanley-Clarke A Dangerous Addiction Two years later her second son Rhett was born.Inside Film Tue 25/02/2014 Tina Hutchence speaks out The family moved to Hong Kong when son Michael was four years old and stayed there until he was twelve years old.Kylie - Naked: A Biography By Jenny Stanley-Clarke A Dangerous Addiction In 1966 while still living in Hong Kong, both Patricia and her daughter Tina became involved in the film Strange Portrait that starred Jeffrey Hunter. Patricia had the makeup artist job and Tina had a small part in the film. Fellow Australian Terry Bourke was involved with the production of the film. The film, however, never saw release.Jeffrey Hunter: The Film, Television, Radio and Stage Performances by Paul Green Page 119 - 120 In 1970, she worked as makeup and hair stylist in the film Noon Sunday. It was her second time working with Bourke.Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences Noon Sunday Her marriage to Hutchence lasted seventeen years.Inside Film Tue 25/02/2014 Tina Hutchence speaks out In 1991, at age 62, she married Ross Glassop, a retired pilot who was in the Royal Australian Air Force.Inside Film Tue 25/02/2014 Tina Hutchence speaks outThe Courier Mail, The Peace Project The group captain who became a groupie by Ruth Matthewson She died at age of 84 on 21 September 2010.Sydney Morning Herald 22 September 2010 Michael Hutchence's devoted mother dies by Ellie Harvey She had three children Tina, Michael and Rhett Hutchence and was survived by Tina and Rhett.Toowoomba Chronicle 24 September 2010 Hutchence's mother dies in Qld ==Author== ===As Patricia Glassop=== * Caring for the family's future : a practical guide to identification and management of perinatal anxiety and depression by Bryanne Barnett, Cathrine Fowler, Patricia Glossop - Chipping Norton, N.S.W. : Surrey Beatty & Sons Pty Ltd, c2004 National Library of Australia Caring for the family's future : a practical guide to identification and management of perinatal anxiety and depression / Bryanne Barnett, Cathrine Fowler, Patricia Glossop * Just a man : the real Michael Hutchence by Tina Hutchence and Patricia Glassop - London : Sidgwick & Jackson, 2000 National Library of Australia Just a man : the real Michael Hutchence / Tina Hutchence and Patricia Glassop ===As Patricia Hutchence=== * Make-up is magic by Patricia Hutchence (paperback) - Crows Nest, N.S.W. : Little Hills Press, 1988 Hardcover title - Make-up is magic, For the 1920s to now, corrective, fantasy and fun National Library of Australia Make-up is magic / Patricia Hutchence ==Makeup and hair stylist== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |+ Television |- !
